sentence.Network_en: She was asked to recount the details of the conversation to the court.
sentence.Network_cn: 她被要求向法庭陈述谈话细节。

sentence.Network_en: She wanted a recount. She couldn't believe that I had got more votes than her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她想要重新计票。她不相信我比她得票多。

sentence.Network_en: When the Labour party candidate didn't win the election, he cried foul and demanded a recount.
sentence.Network_cn: 工党候选人没有赢得选举, 他声称有舞弊行为,要求重新计票.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old Northern French reconter 'tell again', based on Old French counter (see count)

entry.def: If you recount a story or event, you tell or describe it to people.

example.ex: He then recounted the story of the interview for his first job...
example.tran: 他接着讲述了自己第一次找工作时面试的情形。

example.ex: He recounted how heavily armed soldiers forced him from the presidential palace.
example.tran: 他讲述了自己是怎样被全副武装的士兵从总统官邸里赶出来的。

entry.tran: （选举中的）重新计票，重新点票
entry.def: A recount is a second count of votes in an election when the result is very close.

example.ex: She wanted a recount. She couldn't believe that I had got more votes than her.
example.tran: 她想要重新计票。她不相信我比她得票多。

means.word_mean: 1. an additional (usually a second) count; especially of the votes in a close election
1. narrate or give a detailed account of;

sentences.sentence: "The father told a story to his child"
"We had to recount all the votes after an accusation of fraud was made"

sentences.en: He recounted and adorned his adventure.
sentences.cn: 他叙述了他那不寻常的经历,多少有点渲染。

sentences.en: He recounted to us his childhood adventures.
sentences.cn: 他向我们讲述了他孩提时代的种种历险。

sentences.en: His life story is recounted in two fascinating volumes of autobiography.
sentences.cn: 这两卷引人入胜的自传小说详述了他的生平。
